description: From Early Modern English platte, a variation (probably dialectal) of plot (“plot of land”); see plat and plot for more.

entries.meaning: Obsolete spelling of plat or plot (scheme, plan, design, map).
examples: 3rdly That it also be recommended to all persons concerned to have their platts passed through the Surveyor Generals Office, and, in all respects, ready for the grant, in case they shall be entitled to the same, by the said 10th of September.

description: From Middle English platten, whence also plait; see plat.

entries.meaning: Obsolete spelling of plat (material made by interweaving, especially material made by interweaving straw, used to make hats).
